p: The net C balance of the forest ecosystem of the northern WI site shows a steady increase in GHG emissions causing a shift from a C sink to a source in 2022 (Fig. 4b). Like coastal SC, this projected shift to a C source is largely a result of forest aging (Fig. 5b) causing net volume and biomass accumulation to approach zero (Additional file 1: Figure S1). This aging effect was coupled with a decline in forest area from deforestation of 0.1%/year. However, over the historical period, forest ecosystem C stocks across all ownerships were relatively stable, a trend that is consistent with inventory data and the process model (Additional file 1: Figure S8). The process model found that increasing CO 2 has caused significant increases in C accumulation over the past few decades for both study sites (Additional file 1: Figure S9).
